children.name: Engine and Drivetrain: This category includes parts related to the powertrain of an ATV, Side-by-Side, or UTV, such as engines, clutches, transmissions, and drivetrains.

Electrical and Lighting: This category includes parts such as batteries, alternators, starters, wiring harnesses, headlights, taillights, and winches that are essential for power, safety, and functionality in ATVs, Side-by-Sides, or UTVs.
Control Systems and Sensors (Including Instrument Clusters, ABS, Airbag, and Vehicle Networks)
Engine Parts: This includes components like pistons, camshafts, crankshafts, valves, cylinder heads, engine blocks, and timing gears.
Automotive Suspension, Steering, and Brake System Components
Disc Brakes (including ventilated disc brakes, drilled disc brakes)
ABS (Anti-lock Brake System) Components (including sensors, valves, and ECUs)
Hand Tool Boxes: Designed for storing hand tools such as wrenches, pliers, and screwdrivers. They can be portable or stationary.
Mechanic's Tool Boxes: Larger than hand tool boxes, these are designed for auto mechanics to store a variety of automotive tools. They often have multiple compartments for organization.
Hand Tools: Wrenches, sockets, screwdrivers, pliers, etc.
Power Tools: Drills, saws, sanders, grinders, etc.
Cutting Power Tools (Saws, Circular Saws, Jigsaws)
Sanding & Finishing Power Tools (Orbital Sanders, Belt Sanders, Sanding Blocks, Polishing Tools)
Grinding & Abrasive Power Tools (Angle Grinders, Die Grinders)
Moped Scooters (also known as Motor Scooters)
BMW X Series (SUVs) - X1, X2, X3, X4, X5, X6, and X7

Pontoon Houseboat: These are flat-bottomed houseboats with wide decks extending from each side of the hull. They're commonly used for leisure and recreation purposes, like cruising, fishing, or as a floating home.

House-Yacht: Essentially a large motor yacht that has been fitted out as a floating home. These vessels offer luxury accommodations, including multiple cabins, dining areas, and recreation spaces. They're designed for ocean cruising and long-term living.

Houseboat with Stilts (Houseboat with pontoons or floats attached to the underside of the hull) - These allow the houseboat to sit above the waterline and reduce the risk of water damage while maintaining stability.
Handbags with Straps (e.g., Clutch Bags, Crossbody Bags)
Womens Tops: Consists of blouses, t-shirts, tanks, sweaters, cardigans, and vests.
Men's Formal Wear (Tuxedos, Suits, Formal Shirts)
Evening & Cocktail Wear (Gowns, Dinner Jackets, Cocktail Dresses)
Boys' Lower Bodywear: Trousers, jeans, shorts, leggings, socks, underwear, and swimwear.
Boys' Headwear: Caps, hats, beanies, bandanas, and hair accessories.
Boys' Footwear: Shoes, sandals, boots, sneakers, flip-flops, and socks.
Boys' Accessories: Belts, ties, watches, bags, backpacks, wallets, and jewelry.
Sports Clothing: Includes items like t-shirts, shorts, tracksuits, and jackets designed for children to wear during various sports activities.
Swimwear: Encompasses items like swimsuits, rash guards, boardshorts, and goggles intended for children to wear while swimming or participating in water sports.
Traditional School Uniforms: Includes items such as blazers, shirts, skirts, trousers, ties, and caps that are commonly associated with traditional educational institutions.
Modern School Uniforms: Consists of more casual clothing items like polo shirts, joggers, hoodies, and leggings designed for a modern or contemporary school setting.

Sportswear: Encompasses athletic clothing such as jerseys, shorts, tracksuits, sneakers, and equipment (e.g., sports bags, protective gear) used during physical education classes or sports activities at schools.
Sock Liners (For sports and blister prevention)
Shoes for Kids (e.g., Sandals, Sneakers, Boots)
Soft-Soled Booties/Shoes: Designed for newborns and very young infants to provide comfort, warmth, and flexibility for their developing feet.
Headwear: Caps, Beanies, Berets, Bows, Hair Accessories
Athletic footwear (Running shoes, Training shoes, Basketball shoes, etc.)
Spike Shoes (for track and field events)
Martial Arts Shoes/Dojos (Karate, Taekwondo, Judo, etc.)
Sneakers (Running shoes, Basketball shoes, Skate shoes, Training shoes, Casual sneakers)
Loafers (Penny loafers, Tassel loafers, Driver loafers, Slip-on loafers)
Derby: A type of Oxford where the front part of the shoe is open.
Work footwear (Work boots, Safety shoes, Wellingtons, etc.)

Safety Footwear: This category includes shoes designed to protect workers from hazards in various industries such as construction, manufacturing, and mining. They feature protective elements like steel toes, non-slip soles, and puncture-resistant materials.
Steel-Toe Wellingtons (combination of safety footwear and Wellingtons)
Work Shoes (lightweight work footwear that may not provide the same level of protection as boots or safety shoes but are still suitable for less hazardous work environments)
Work Sandals (work footwear designed with open toes and straps, suitable for warm weather or less protective work environments)
Work Clogs (similar to sandals but feature a closed heel and often a solid sole)
Water footwear (Aqua socks, Water shoes, Swim shoes, etc.)
Beach Sandals (optional, as they are technically not 'footwear' for swimming, but often used in water activities)
Sandal footwear (Flip flops, Slides, Clogs, Thongs, etc.)
High-heeled footwear (Stilettos, Kitten heels, Wedges, Platforms, etc.)
Flat footwear (Mary Janes, Ballet flats, Espadrilles, etc.)
Indoor footwear (Slippers, House shoes, Slides, etc.)
House Shoes: Also known as indoor slippers, house shoes are designed to be worn indoors only. They come in various styles such as moccasins, clogs, or loafers.
Kids' footwear (Toddler shoes, Children's sneakers, Sandals, Booties, etc.)
Hats: Top hats, bowler hats, fedoras, berets, baseball caps, beanies, sunhats, cowboy hats, straw hats, and wide-brimmed hats
Tall Hats: Includes Top hats, Cowboy hats, and Wide-brimmed hats.
Brimmed Hats: Includes Fedoras, Berets, Straw hats, and Wide-brimmed hats.
Casual Hats: Includes Baseball caps, Beanies, Sunhats.
Caps: Baseball caps, snapbacks, bucket hats, newsboy caps, beanies, berets, mortar boards, bowler caps, and soft caps
Baby Outfits (Sets including shirts, pants, hats, socks, etc.)
Baby Diapers (Disposable Diapers, Cloth Diapers, Training Pants)
Boys' Underwear: Includes boxers, briefs, boxer briefs, trunks, and shorts for boys.
Boys' Swimwear: Includes swim trunks, board shorts, swim briefs, rash guards, swim shirts, and swim diapers.
Sports Memorabilia, Fan Shop & Sports Cards
T-shirts, Sweatshirts, and Other Clothing Items
Baseball Memorabilia (e.g., signed baseballs, bats, jerseys)
Basketball Memorabilia (e.g., signed basketballs, jerseys, shoes)
Football Memorabilia (e.g., signed footballs, helmets, jerseys)
Game-Used Equipment (e.g., Bats, Balls, Helmets, Gloves)
Game-Signed Items (e.g., Balls, Pucks, Photographs, Collectible Cards)
Collectible Knives, Swords, Blades, Armors & Accessories
Accessories: This subclass includes various items related to knives, swords, blades, armors, and accessories, such as sheaths, scabbards, sword belts, and other carrying equipment.
Graphic Art & Prints (e.g., etchings, lithographs, engravings, posters)
German Reichsbank Notes (not a coin but often classified as world coins)
Stater: Ancient Greek and Etruscan silver or bronze coins that were originally used for weighing goods, but became widely used as currency.
Costumes and Textile Doll Clothes (Category A06.09)
Footwear, Parts Thereof and Accessories (Category A08.01)
Collectible Dollhouses (often limited editions or brand collaborations)
Plush Teddy Bears (Soft-stuffed animals resembling a bear)
Collectible Teddy Bears (Limited edition, rare, and special teddy bears)
Articulated Teddy Bears (Teddy bears with movable joints for posability)
Fashion Teddy Bears (Teddy bears designed to mimic or complement clothing styles)
Costume Teddy Bears (Teddy bears dressed in various costumes for different occasions)
Musical Teddy Bears (Teddy bears equipped with sound devices to play music or songs)
Baby Teddy Bears (Smaller teddy bears designed for infants and young children)
Pre-Columbian Art (American Indian, Mesoamerican, and Andean)
Needlework Tools: Includes hand-sewing tools such as sewing needles, thimbles, scissors, embroidery needles, tapestry needles, crochet hooks, and knitting needles.
Sewing Threads, Needles, and Notions (including sewing patterns)
Silk Fabrics (Silk noil, Habotai silk, Tussah silk)
Painting and Drawing Supplies: Brushes, Paint, Canvas, Sketchbooks, Charcoal, Pastels, Ink, Markers, etc.
Crafting Supplies: Yarn, Fabric, Beads, Glue, Scissors, Buttons, Needles, Thread, Ribbons, Paper, Stickers, Embellishments, etc.
Decorative Crafting Supplies (Beads, Glue, Scissors, Stickers, Embellishments, Paper)
Fine Art Posters (e.g., Classic Art, Contemporary Art)
Graphic Design Art Posters (e.g., Advertising, Promotional)
Illustrative Art Posters (e.g., Comics and Cartoons, Concept Art)
Baked Ware (Includes dishes made from clay, porcelain, and stoneware for baking or serving baked goods)
Casserole Dishes (Large, deep, lidded pots used for cooking and serving one-pot meals)
Autographs on Items Associated with Performers or Events (e.g., props, costumes, musical instruments)
Autographs & Ephemera: Contains autographed scripts, letters, production materials, and other memorabilia related to the movie industry.
Music Memorabilia (autographed albums, instruments, concert posters)
Autographed Albums: Items comprising vinyl records, compact discs, cassettes, or other forms of album media that have been signed by musicians or associated personnel.
Theatrical and Live Event Memorabilia (playbills, signed scripts, backstage passes)
Playbills: Physical programs distributed at live theater performances, typically containing information such as cast lists, production credits, and scene descriptions.
Definitive Stamps (also known as Regular Issues)
Arabian Peninsula: This subclass includes stamps from countries such as Saudi Arabia, Yemen, Oman, and United Arab Emirates.
Levant: Covers stamps of countries like Lebanon, Syria, Jordan, and Palestine.
Iran (Persia): Stamps from the historical region and modern-day country of Iran.
Postal Stationery (PS) - PD stamps issued on pre-printed envelopes, postcards, or other stationery items.
Rifle Scopes: These are optical devices designed to aid in sighting and precision shooting. They are commonly used for hunting and target shooting.
Hunting Gear: Camouflage clothing, hunting knives, binoculars, game calls, and decoys.
Golf Tops: Includes polo shirts, golf shirts, sweaters, jackets, and vests designed for golfing.
Golf Shoes: Includes spiked golf shoes, spikeless golf shoes, and golf sandals.
Golf Accessories: Covers hats, visors, gloves, golf bags, towels, umbrellas, belts, and other miscellaneous items used in golf.
Golf Clubs (Driver, Iron Sets, Hybrids, Putter, Wedges)
Golf Apparel and Equipment (Golf Shoes, Gloves, Golf Bag, Umbrellas, Golf Caps/Hats)
Golf Clubs: Includes drivers, fairway woods, irons, wedges, putters
Wedges (includes Specialty wedges like the Bunker sand wedge, Approach wedge, and Gap wedge)
Golf Balls: Divided into categories like distance balls, premium balls, and value balls
Golf Accessories: Golf bags, tees, gloves, ball markers, golf towels, GPS devices, etc.
Club Accessories (Tees, Golf Gloves, Ball Markers, Towels)
Brakes (Rim brakes, Disc brakes, Brake levers, Brake pads)

Timeless Cycling Accessories: Comprises components like leather handlebars, Brooks saddles, wicker baskets, chain guards, and vintage pedals, all contributing to the retro charm of vintage cycling equipment.
Road Bike Frame: Designed for pavement use with drop handlebars, thin tires, and a lightweight construction for speed and efficiency.
Pneumatic Air Guns (e.g., CO2, Pre-charged Pneumatic)
Gas Ram air Guns (e.g., Hydrogen, Nitrogen, etc.)
Saddlery: Includes saddles, bridles, stirrups, girths, and related accessories used for riding horses.
Winter Sports (e.g., Skiing, Snowboarding, Ice Skating)
Ice Hockey (often considered a winter sport but technically played on ice rather than snow)
Trolling Reels (also known as Offshore Reels or Saltwater Reels)
Artificial Lures: Soft Plastics, Hard Bodies, Spinnerbaits, Crankbaits, Jigs, Spoons
Natural Baits: Worms, Minnows, Leeches, Shrimp, Nightcrawlers
Flies: Dry Flies, Nymphs, Streamers, Poppers, Wet Flies
Fishing Reels (Spinning Reels, Baitcasting Reels, etc.)
Wading and Swimwear (Waders, Neoprene Suits, Swim Shoes)
Footwear (Rubber Boots, Fishing Shoes, Waterproof Socks)
Accessories (Glove Liners, Buff Headwear, Polarized Sunglasses, Fishing Hats)
Goalkeeping Equipment: Includes items such as goalkeeper gloves, jerseys, protective padding, and goalkeeper boots.
Ball Equipment: Comprises soccer balls in various sizes, materials, and designs for different age groups and playing conditions.
Player Equipment: Consists of elements like jerseys, shorts, socks, shin guards, cleats or turf shoes, and protective headgear for goalkeepers and field players.
Player Equipment: Cleats (Footwear), Shirts, Shorts, Socks, Gloves
Bowling Ball: This includes various types such as Plastic, Urethane, Reactive Resin, Particle, and High Performance.
Sticks and Balls (for each type of hockey)
Athletic Apparel: Includes jerseys, shorts, socks, and other clothing items designed for basketball players.
Footwear: Consists of basketball shoes, ankle supports, and other foot-related equipment.
Heart Rate Monitors and Fitness Trackers
Weight Machines (Bench Press, Squat Racks, Leg Press)
Wearable Technology: Includes devices such as smartwatches, fitness trackers, and heart rate monitors that can be worn on the body to monitor physical activity, heart rate, sleep patterns, etc.
Cardiovascular Equipment: Treadmills, Ellipticals, Stationary Bikes, Rowing Machines, Steppers
Resistance Training Equipment: Dumbbells, Barbells, Kettlebells, Weight Machines, Resistance Bands
Accessories and Apparel: Yoga Mats, Exercise Mats, Fitness Trackers, Heart Rate Monitors, Workout Clothing
Athletic Footwear (Running Shoes, Cross-Training Shoes, Yoga Shoes)
Exercise Apparel (Running Clothes, Sports Bras, Yoga Mats)
Yoga Mat with built-in accessories (e.g., straps, towels)
Training Equipment (Dumbbells, Resistance Bands, Yoga Blocks)
Resistance Band Kits (Combination of different bands for versatile workouts)
Cookware & Utensils: Pots, pans, utensils, and cutlery specifically designed for camping.
Fuel & Heat Sources: Gas canisters, stoves, matches, and lighter for cooking while camping.
Recreational Snowshoeing: Primarily for leisurely exploration of winter landscapes.
Accessories (Compasses, dive knives, lights, underwater cameras, etc.)
Swimming Sports (e.g., Diving, Swimming, Water Polo)
Competitive Swimming: This includes freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, butterfly, and individual medley events.
Cross-Training Shoes: Suitable for a variety of activities like aerobics, weightlifting, and gym workouts. They offer versatile traction and stability features.
Sports Balls (Basketballs, Soccer Balls, Baseballs, etc.)
Padded and Inflatable (American Footballs with air pressure, Rugby balls)
Athletic Clothing: Includes items like jerseys, shorts, leggings, tracksuits, and training tops designed for various sports activities.
Activewear (Includes training tops, yoga pants, sport bras)
Sports Accessories (Includes socks, gloves, caps, protective gear)
Collectible Card Game Mixed Card Lots
Tekken-like: 3D fighting arena, character customization, grappling mechanics, and destructible environments.
Marker-Based AR Games (e.g., Artificial Intelligence - A.I. Marker Games)
Projection Keyboard AR Games (e.g., Castle in the Dark)
Mixed Reality AR Games (e.g., Microsoft's HoloLens games)
Image Recognition AR Games (e.g., Jurassic World Alive)
Modern Diecast: These are replicas of contemporary vehicles, including current model cars, trucks, and vans. This category includes popular makes like Tesla, BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and many more.
Diecast & Toy Vehicle Accessories, Parts & Display
LEGO Architecture/LEGO Ideas (for more adult builders and architecturally themed models)
Educational Building Toys: Magformers, Tinkertoy, Snap Circuits
Action-Adventure Game (optional, considering 3 is the request but it's an important subclass of Electronic Games)
Board Game Pieces: Pawns, Tokens, Dice, Tiles
Card Game Components: Cards, Decks, Sleeves, Cardboards
Team Sports Games (e.g., Soccer, Basketball, American Football)
Individual Sports Games (e.g., Tennis, Golf, Racing)
Arcade-style Sports Games (e.g., Skeeball, Air Hockey, Ping Pong)
Hybrid Electric Trains (combination of both DC and AC systems)
RC Model Vehicles, Toys & Control Line
Hobby RC Model Vehicle Parts & Accessories
Aircraft Parts and Accessories (Airplanes, Drones, Helicopters)
Ground Vehicles Parts and Accessories (Cars, Trucks, Boats, Tanks)
Wooden Boat & Ship Models and Kits
Radio Controlled (RC) Boats and Ships Models and Kits
Metal, Plastic, or Resin Boat & Ship Models and Kits
Kitchen Toy Replicas (e.g., pretend stoves, ovens, etc.)
Toy Animals with Sounds (Talking plush animals, Musical plush animals)
Interactive Stuffed Animals (Animatronic stuffed animals, Smart plush animals)
Animal Plush Toys (e.g., bears, dogs, cats, etc.)
Fantasy/Mythical Plush Toys (e.g., dragons, unicorns, mermaids, etc.)
Character Plush Toys (based on popular movies, TV shows, books, comics, etc.)
Ride-on Toys (e.g., toy cars, push cars, balance bikes)
Traditional Pedal Cars: These are the standard pedal cars that resemble smaller versions of regular vehicles. They typically have four wheels and are designed for children to pedal and drive around.

Tent Playhouses: These combine the characteristics of tents and playhouses. They can be easily moved and set up like tents but are designed for children's play, often with features like windows, doors, and interior shelves or benches.
Outdoor Sports Equipment (e.g., goal posts, basketball hoops)
Basketball Equipment: Consists of basketball hoops, balls, backboards, nets, and related accessories.

Interactive Games & Puzzles: Toys that involve electronic components for enhanced interactivity and entertainment. Examples include electronic board games, video games, and electronic puzzles with LCD screens or sensors.
Handheld Electronic Toys (Electronic Games, Dolls, Musical Instruments)
Handheld Games and Gadgets (Drones, Robots, etc.)
Classic Beanbag Plushie: These are the standard beanbag plushies, filled with beans or polystyrene beads to provide a soft and squishy feel.
Round Beanbag Plushies: These have a rounded, spherical shape, often resembling a traditional beanbag toy.
Character Beanbag Plushies: These are designed to look like popular cartoon characters, animals, or creatures, making them appealing to kids and collectors.
Specialty Shape Beanbag Plushies: These come in various shapes other than round, such as hearts, stars, or specific animal forms, adding uniqueness to the beanbag plushie collection.
Board Games: Chess, Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, Settlers of Catan
Strategy Board Games (Chess, Risk, Settlers of Catan)
Visual Arts (Painting, Sculpture, Graphic Design, Photography)
Contemporary Clock Designs - Features modern designs, minimalistic aesthetics, unique shapes, and the use of new materials.

Lawn Mower Parts & Accessories: These include but are not limited to mower blades, decks, belts, spark plugs, air filters, fuel tanks, grass bags, mulch kits, wheels, and maintenance tools such as oil, lubricant, and sharpening stones.
Monocots: Orchids, grasses, lilies, irises, palms, bananas
Dicots: Roses, sunflowers, oaks, daisies, peonies, beans, tomatoes
Picnic and Camping Equipment (for eating outdoors)
Pest Control and Disease Management in Lawns and Turf
Hand Tools: Trowels, Spades, Forks, Shears, Pruners, Shovels, Hoes
Accessories: Gloves, Knee Pads, Garden Markers, Watering Cans, Seedlings Trays & Pots, Gardening Aprons, Tool Carriers/Caddies, Hose Reels
Food Preparation Storage (Pots, Pans, Utensils Storage)
Tableware: Includes dishes used at a table, such as plates, bowls, cups, saucers, and cutlery.
Servingware: Encompasses items used to serve food at the table, including trays, platters, bowls, pitchers, and gravy boats.
Pneumatic Power Tools (Air Compressors, Jackhammers, Nail Guns)
Cordless Power Tools (Drills, Circular Saws, Reciprocating Saws)
Mechanic's Tool Boxes (e.g., Hand tool sets, Power tool sets)
Electrician's Tool Boxes (e.g., Wire strippers, Multimeters, Pliers)
Carpentry & Woodworking Tool Boxes (e.g., Screwdrivers, Saws, Hammers)
Plumbing & Hardware Tool Boxes (e.g., Wrenches, Pipe wrenches, Pipe pliers)
Home Repair & DIY Tool Boxes (Multipurpose tool sets suitable for general home repairs and small-scale DIY projects)
Pneumatic Impact Tools (Impact Wrenches, Jackhammers, etc.)
Air Drills (Rotary Hammer Drills, Cordless Impact Drills, etc.)
Air Saw Tools (Jigsaws, Reciprocating Saws, Circular Saws, etc.)
Air Spraying Equipment (Spray Painters, Airbrushes, etc.)
Portable Air Compressors (Reciprocating, Rotary Screw, and Centrifugal Compressors)
Air Treatment and Accessories (Regulators, Filters, Lubricators, Pressure Gauges, etc.)
Hand Tools: Screwdrivers, hammers, pliers, saws, wrenches, files, etc.
Fastening Tools (Includes Screwdrivers): Flathead, Phillips, Torx, Slot, Hex, and Star Drives.
Impact Tools: Claw Hammers, Ball Peen Hammers, Sledgehammers, Rubber Mallets.
Cutting Tools (Includes Pliers, Files, and Saws): Pliers (Lineman's, Diagonal, Needle-nose), Wire Cutters, Tin Snips, Hacksaw, Coping Saw, File (Rat tail, Mill, Cabinet, etc.).
Specialty Hand Tools (Includes Pliers and Others): Pipe Wrenches, Crescent Wrench, Locking Pliers (Vise Grip), Hydraulic Pliers, Wire Strippers, Scissors.
Workshop Machines: Lathes, milling machines, bandsaws, planers, shapers, etc.
Sawing Machines (Band saws, Circular saws, etc.)
Table Sets: Includes dining tables, leaf extensions, and table accessories such as tablecloths and centerpieces.
Seating Sets: Consists of dining chairs, benches, and seat cushions for comfortable seating during meals.
Upholstered Chairs: Chairs with padding on their seats and backs, providing comfort and support.
Sofas: Large upholstered seating pieces designed for multiple people to sit on, often with armrests.
Electrical and Plumbing Supplies (e.g., wires, pipes, fixtures)
Tools & Hardware (e.g., hammers, screwdrivers, nails, bolts)
Power Distribution Equipment (Transformers, Switches, Circuit Breakers)
Access Control Devices (Door Locks, Keypads, Biometrics)
Household Care Products (e.g., all-purpose cleaners, glass cleaners, oven cleaners)
Detergents and Cleaning Agents (Includes all-purpose cleaners, dishwashing liquids, laundry detergents)
Surface Care Products (Includes glass cleaners, polishes, furniture polish)
Home Disinfectants and Sanitizers (Includes household bleach, multipurpose disinfectants, antibacterial sprays)
Cleaning Tools and Equipment (e.g., brooms, mops, sponges, brushes)
Handheld Cleaning Tools: This subclass includes items that can be easily held and manipulated with one or both hands. Examples are brooms, dustpans, sponges, mops, and brushes.
Woven blankets (e.g., woolen blankets, cotton blankets)
Throw blankets (e.g., fleece throws, knitted throws)
Flat Sheet (also known as a single bed sheet)
Fluorescent Light Bulbs (including Compact Fluorescent Lamps)
LED Table Lamp (or Modern Table Lamp)
Tabletop Floor Lamps: These are smaller floor lamps designed to be placed on a table or floor surface. They often have slimmer bases compared to standard floor lamps.

Torchiere Floor Lamps: These floor lamps have an upright design with the bulb and shade at the top of the lamp, directing light upwards and outwards, providing ambient light rather than task lighting.
Crystal Pendants/Chandeliers: These lamps feature crystal pendants, beads or prisms that refract light in various ways to create a stunning visual effect.
Ceiling Fans (Since it was mentioned in the question)
Directional Ceiling Fans: These fans have adjustable blades that allow air to be directed towards specific areas, making them ideal for larger rooms and spaces with multiple seating areas.
Soft Drinks: Cola (Coca-Cola, Pepsi), Lemonade, Soda Water, Fruit Sodas, Energy Drinks
Flours (e.g., wheat flour, cornmeal, rice flour)
Breads and rolls (e.g., white bread, whole grain bread, baguettes, dinner rolls)
Breakfast cereals (e.g., oat-based cereals, corn flakes, granola, puffed wheat)
Biscuits and cookies (e.g., shortbread, sugar cookies, ginger snaps, animal crackers)
Cakes, muffins, and quick breads (e.g., pound cake, banana nut muffins, zucchini bread)

Hot Beverages (Hot Chocolate, Cocoa, Herbal Tea, Infusions)
Oil-based Condiments: Mayonnaise, Ketchup, Salad Dressing
Spice Mixes and Blends: Cajun Seasoning, Curry Powder, Italian Seasoning
Miscellaneous Food Preparations (includes coffee, tea, cocoa, etc.)
Beverage Mixes and Powders: This includes instant coffee, tea mixes, cocoa powders, etc.

Bathroom Storage Solutions (for shower and bathtub)
Bathtub and Shower Wall Niche Kits
Bathtub Filters, Jets, and Massage Systems

Bathroom Mirrors (for use near shower or bathtub)

Bidets (Electric Bidet Seats, Standalone Bidets, Integrated Bidets)

Lighting Fixtures (Vanity Lights, Mirror Lights, Ceiling Lights)
Hardware & Accessories (Faucets, Shower Heads, Towel Racks, Soap Dispensers)
Holiday/Seasonal Cards (e.g., Christmas, Valentine's Day, Easter)
Grief and Loss: These cards are designed to express sympathy for those who have lost a loved one due to death. They often feature comforting messages and imagery.
Holiday/Seasonal Cards (e.g., Christmas, Valentine's Day, New Year)
Birthday Cards (often associated with specific age groups such as Baby Shower, Children's Birthday, etc.)
Modern/Contemporary thank you cards (e.g. digital, minimalist design)
Formal Invitations: Includes letterpress, digital, and engraved invitations for formal graduation ceremonies.
DIY (Do-It-Yourself) Invitations: Consists of kits and materials for creating customized graduation invitations at home.
Tableware Decorations: Refers to items used to decorate tables at parties such as plates, cups, napkins, tablecloths, centerpieces, and table runners.
Gift Accessories: This subclass includes ribbons, bows, tags, gift cards, and other decorative elements used to enhance the presentation of a wrapped gift.
Stationery (e.g., invitations, thank-you notes, writing paper)
Paper Goods: Notebooks, copy paper, sketchbooks, envelopes, postcards, etc.
Votive Candle Holders (Glass Candle Holder, Floating Candle Holder)
Hurricane Lanterns and Lamps (Bormioli Rocco Hurricane Lantern, Hurricane Jar Candle Holder)
Container Candles (e.g., jar candles, tea light holders)

Fruity Scented Room & Linen Sprays (e.g., Lemon, Orange, Mango, Peach)
Fresh & Clean Scented Room & Linen Sprays (e.g., Citrus Blend, Ocean Breeze, Green Apple)
Oriental (Includes Chinese, Indian, and Caucasian rugs)
Indian Rugs (including Mughal and Kashmiri rugs)
Small Kitchen Appliances Parts and Accessories (optional, as it's not one of the top 3 categories but still relevant)
Ranges (Dual Fuel, Electric, Gas, Smart, Glass Top)
Refrigerator Parts & Accessories: This includes items such as door seals, water filters, shelf liners, ice makers, temperature controls, and more.
Dryer Parts (e.g., heating elements, drum supports, door seals)
Accessories (e.g., laundry detergent dispensers, fabric softeners)

Accessories (Optional): Additional components that enhance the functionality of smart speakers and hubs. Examples are smart light bulbs (Philips Hue), smart plugs (TP-Link Smart Plug), smart security cameras (Nest Cam), etc. These accessories can be controlled through a voice assistant or a smart hub.
Security Cameras (IP Cameras, CCTV Cameras, Network Cameras)
IoT Sensors and Monitoring Devices (Smart Locks, Doorbell Cameras, Smoke Detectors, etc.)

Home Security Subclass: This includes devices such as smart locks, doorbell cameras, surveillance cameras, alarm systems, and motion sensors. These devices are primarily used for monitoring and securing a home.
Cases, Bags, and Accessories for Portability
Android Phones (e.g., Samsung Galaxy, Google Pixel)
Feature Phones (e.g., Nokia 3310, Alcatel GO FLIP 3)
SIM Card Slots and NFC Components
Prepaid Cell Phone Cards (Top-up, Pay-as-you-go, Refillable cards)
Postpaid Cell Phone Cards (Monthly subscription-based plans)
Data-only SIM Cards (for tablets, mobile hotspots, etc.)

Wear OS Sport: Designed for fitness enthusiasts and athletes, these watches offer advanced tracking features like heart rate monitors, GPS, and workout coaching. Examples include Fossil Sport and Garmin Wear OS smartwatches.
Video Game Soundtracks and Music (physical or digital releases)
Cameras (Vintage Film Cameras, Medium Format Cameras, Large Format Cameras)
Lighting Equipment (Vintage Studio Lights, Cinema Lights, Portable Flash Units)
Action Cameras (GoPro, DJI Osmo Action, etc.)

Mountable Action Cameras: Examples include GoPro Hero series, DJI Osmo Action, and Insta360 ONE R. These cameras are designed for extreme sports and adventure activities, with waterproof bodies and mounts that allow hands-free recording.
Medium Format Cameras (Phase One, Hasselblad, etc.)
Folding Medium Format Cameras - Examples: Mamiya RZ series, Pentax 645Z
Stereo Camera Systems: These are two camera systems that record from slightly different angles to create a three-dimensional image.
Medium Format Camera (often considered a large format but technically mid-sized)
4x5" Large Format Camera (specific camera size often used to define large format cameras)

Compact Cameras with Phone Capabilities (often called "bridge" cameras): These devices offer a compact size while incorporating advanced camera features such as interchangeable lenses, manual controls, and larger image sensors compared to standard smartphones. Examples: Sony RX100 series, Canon PowerShot G series
Home Theater Systems and Equipment (Projectors, Sound Systems, etc.)
Television Sets (e.g., LED TVs, Smart TVs, 4K TVs)
Video Accessories (e.g., HDMI cables, Video projectors, Streaming devices)
Smart TVs (Although not a type of display technology, it's a common classification for televisions that have internet connectivity and apps built-in)
Video Equipment (DVD Players, Blu-ray Players, Video Game Consoles)
Home Audio Electronics (Speakers, Receivers, Headphones, Portable Audio Players)
Portable Audio Players (if considered as a separate category from speakers and headphones)
Speakers (Car Speakers, Component Speakers, Coaxial Speakers)
Amplifiers (Class D Amplifiers, Car Audio Amplifiers, Multichannel Amplifiers)
In-Car Entertainment: Includes audio systems, GPS navigation devices, and car radio accessories.
Navigation and Location Systems (GPS, GNSS, mapping software)
Wireless Headphones (Bluetooth, RF, and True Wireless)
Portable MP3 Players (e.g., Apple iPod, Sony Walkman)

Car/Auto MP3 Players (e.g., Pioneer DEH-S620BS, Kenwood DNN990DAB)
Battery-Powered Portable Weather Band AM/FM Radios
Low Light Level Night Vision Cameras (LLLNVC)
Wired Doorbell Cameras: These are connected to your existing doorbell wiring for power and have a physical connection to the chime box. Examples include: Ring Video Doorbell 2, Google Nest Hello.

Wireless (Battery-powered) Doorbell Cameras: These operate on rechargeable batteries and don't require any wiring. They connect to your Wi-Fi network for remote access. Examples include: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus, Arlo Video Doorbell.
PoE (Power over Ethernet) Local Storage Systems
Smart Video Analytics Cameras (Including Object and People Counters, License Plate Readers)
Wired vs Wireless Home Surveillance Systems
Semiconductor Electronic Devices and Circuits (including Opto-electronics)
Watch Cases and Frames (Material: Stainless Steel, Gold, Titanium, Ceramic)
Watch Faces and Dials (Analog, Digital, Smartwatch Screens)
Mechanical Watches: These timepieces use mechanical movements to keep time, with components like gears and springs.
Watch Bands and Straps - Leather, Silicone, Metal, Nylon, Rubber, etc.
Silicone: These are flexible, waterproof, and durable watch bands suitable for daily wear and sports activities.
Numerous Charm (also known as Protective Enchantment)
Precious Metal Jewelry (E.g., Gold, Silver, Platinum)
Gemstone Jewelry (E.g., Diamonds, Sapphires, Rubies, Emeralds)
Red Gems: Rubies, Garnets (Rhodolites and Almandites)
Green Gems: Emeralds, Peridots, Jade, Tsavorite
Yellow Gems: Citrine, Topaz, Yellow Sapphires, Heliodor (Yellow Birch)
Pink/Purple/Orange/Violet Gems: Morganite, Padparadscha, Spinel, Amethyst, Zircon, Tourmaline
Costume Jewelry (Plastic, Glass, or other materials used to imitate precious jewelry)
Plastic Costume Jewelry: This category includes costume jewelry made primarily from plastic and resin materials, often featuring intricate designs, beads, or charms.
Glass Costume Jewelry: This type of costume jewelry is created using glass, enamel, or other similar transparent materials to resemble precious gems such as diamonds, rubies, or sapphires.

Other Materials Costume Jewelry: This category includes any costume jewelry made from materials like metal plating, beads (not precious stones), rhinestones, pearls, and composite materials designed to mimic precious metals and gemstones. Examples may include shell or bone-based jewelry, among others.

Gemstone Vintage Pendants: These vintage pendants often feature precious gemstones such as diamonds, emeralds, rubies, and sapphires. The gems are usually of high quality and add a luxurious touch to the pendant.
Clarifying/Treatment Shampoos & Conditioners (includes for example: volumizing, color-protecting, dandruff treatment, etc.)
Tape-in, Fusion, and Clip-on Hair Extensions
Micro Ring, Micro Loop, and Nano Ring Hair Extensions
Treatments and Styling Creams/Serums (Hot Oil Treatments, Leave-In Conditioners, Anti-Frizz Serums)

Scalp Treatments (e.g., Dandruff Control, Itch Relief)
Hair Straightening Treatments (e.g., Brazilian Blowout, Keratin Treatment)
Hair Growth Treatments (e.g., Minoxidil, PRP Therapy)
Hairstyling Products (e.g., Hairspray, Gels, Mousses, Pomades)
Sprays: Includes products like hairspray, dry shampoo, texturizing spray, heat protectant spray.
Styling Aids: Comprises of gels, mousses, pomades, waxes, and clays that are used to style, hold, or add texture to hair.
Minerals Supplements: These include individual mineral supplements such as calcium, magnesium, potassium, zinc, and iron, among others.
Antioxidants (Vitamin E, Vitamin C, Beta Carotene, etc.)
Emulsion Moisturizers (Combination of oil and water)
Vitamin C (Ascorbic Acid) Skin Brightening Creams

Makeup Removers (Cleansing Wipes, Cotton Pads, Makeup Remover Liquids)

Tools for Face Makeup (Concealer Brushes, Foundation Brushes, Powder Puffs)

Face Makeup: This includes foundation, concealer, BB cream, CC cream, powder, bronzer, blush, and contour products.
Base Makeup: Foundation, Concealer, BB Cream, CC Cream
Color Products: Bronzer, Blush, Contour Products (Highlighters and Sculpting Powders)
Eye Makeup: Includes eyeliner (gel, pencil, liquid), mascara, eye shadow, and eyebrow products like pencils, powders, gels, and pomades.
Eyeliner Subclass: This includes gel eyeliners, pencil eyeliners, liquid eyeliners, and felt-tip liners.
Eyebrow Products Subclass: Comprises eyebrow pencils, brow powders, gel brows, tinted gels, and pomades for eyebrows.
Lip Makeup: Comprising of lipsticks, lip glosses, lip liners, lip balms, and lipliners.

Lipliner (Already mentioned in 1st point, but I'll add it again for clarity): This is a type of cosmetic pencil used to outline the lips before applying lipstick or lip gloss. It can also be worn alone for a more defined lip look.

Assistive Walking Devices: Equipment like crutches, canes, walkers, and wheelchairs that assist individuals with mobility difficulties to walk or move around.
Full Frame: These glasses have a complete frame covering the lenses and the sides. They are ideal for larger faces and provide more protection from peripheral light.
Exfoliating Body Scrubs (technically a scrub, but often classified under body soaps)

Cuticle Tools (Push Cuticles, Stick Cuticles, Scissors)

Massage Devices (e.g., foot rollers, vibrating massage tools)
Lip Products: Includes lipsticks, lip glosses, lip balms, and lip liners.
Skin Care Products (Including Soaps, Shampoos, Lotions, Moisturizers)
Cleansers: This includes soaps, face washes, hand soaps, and body washes.
Hair Care Products: This includes shampoos, conditioners, hair gels, mousses, and hairsprays.
Moisturizers & Lotions: This includes facial moisturizers, body lotions, hand creams, and sunscreens.
Electrical Components: Wiring, switches, sensors, and control systems for heavy equipment.
Structural Components: Frames, axles, suspensions, wheels, and other essential parts of the heavy equipment's physical structure.
Wheels (optional as it was not explicitly listed as a subclass, but essential for heavy equipment)
Attachments: Buckets, drills, mowers, grapples, and various other tools or accessories that can be added to heavy machinery.
Surgical Handpieces (Burrs, Bone Cutters, and Aspiration Tips)
Restorative Handpieces (Diamond Burs, Tapered Fissure Burrs, and Inlay/Onlay Handpieces)
Laboratory Furniture (Includes: Workstations, Cabinets, and Storage Units)
Patient Care Furniture (Includes: Recliners, Seating, and Mobility Aids)
Caregiver Equipment (Includes: Hoists, Transfer Devices, and Patient Lifts)
Surgical Instrument Attachments (e.g., laparoscopic instrument attachments, arthroscopic instrument attachments)
Diagnostic Attachment and Accessories (e.g., ultrasound probes, MRI coils, endoscopy accessories)
Sampling & Collection Attachments (e.g., blood sampling needles, swabs, fluid collection systems)
Soldering Equipment: Consists of soldering irons, heat guns, fluxes, solder wires, and fume extraction equipment for various soldering applications.
Tool Holder Types (e.g., milling, drilling, tapping holders)
Specialty Vehicles: These include food trucks specialized in specific cuisines like tacos, hot dogs, ice cream, or desserts.

Food Service Carts & Trailers: These are smaller mobile units that may be towed or pushed to different locations, typically used for selling snacks, drinks, and quick meals. Examples include hot dog carts, coffee carts, and crepe stands.
Food and Beverage Vending Machines: These machines dispense a variety of food items such as snacks, candies, and soft drinks.
Merchandise/Product Vending Machines: These machines dispense non-food items like cosmetics, toys, books, and electronic accessories.
Bar Equipment: This includes bar blenders, cocktail shakers, draft beer systems, kegerators, and glassware.

Automation and Control Systems (SCADA, RTU, PLC)
Office Software Solutions (optional, if you consider software as office equipment)
Paper Products: Notebooks, binders, paper clips, post-it notes, envelopes, stationery
Office Equipment: Printers, scanners, copiers, staplers, calculators, telephones
Power Hand Tools: These are industrial hand tools that utilize electric, air, or battery power for operation. Examples include drills, circular saws, and jigsaws.
Manual Hand Tools: These are industrial hand tools operated by physical force such as hammers, wrenches, and pliers.
Leveling Instruments (Clinometers, Automatic Levels, Laser Levels)
Electromechanical Testers (e.g., Multimeters, Oscilloscopes, Power Supplies)
Multimeters: Instruments used to measure multiple electrical values such as voltage, current, resistance, and continuity.
Oscilloscopes: Electronic test equipment that graphically displays varying signal voltages versus time.
Optoelectronic Testers (e.g., Spectrometers, Laser Alignment Systems, Photometric Equipment)
Nondestructive Testing Instruments (e.g., Ultrasonic Flaw Detection Devices, Magnetic Particle Inspection Systems, Radiographic Equipment)
Water Pumps (Submersible, Centrifugal, Jet, and Vertical Turbine)
Vacuum Pumps (Rotary vane, liquid ring, and oil)
Centrifugal Blowers (Axial Flow, Mixed Flow, Radial Flow)
Hydrodynamics: The study of fluid motion when the effects of viscosity are significant.
Aerodynamics: The study of the motion of air, especially around bodies immersed in it.

Hydraulics: The branch of engineering that deals with the practical applications of the principles of fluid mechanics to fluids under pressure, particularly liquids. This includes the design and analysis of components such as pumps, valves, and piping systems.
designed pneumatic system might also include the following:
Instrumentation Subsystem: Sensors, gauges, and indicators that monitor the performance and status of the pneumatic system.
Positive Displacement Pumps (including Rotary and Reciprocating Types)
Positive Displacement Reciprocating Pumps: These pumps displace a fixed volume of fluid for each cycle of the pumping action. Examples include piston pumps and diaphragm pumps.

Automated Warehouse Loading and Unloading Systems
Intrusion Detection Systems (Motion sensors, alarms, etc.)
Dog Topical Flea & Tick Remedies & Collars

Collars: Flea and tick collars are infused with insecticides that continuously release active ingredients over an extended period (usually several months) to protect dogs from flea and tick infestations.

Oral Medications (optional): Although not typically considered a topical remedy, oral medications like tablets and chewables are also available to treat and prevent flea and tick infestations in dogs.
Nutritional Supplies: Food, treats, vitamins, and supplements for dogs.
Prong Collar or Chain Slip Collar
